author: icthus_saltsa
post: I dispute Tersio's assertion about the motives of forgers (and deplore his cheap swipe at skeptics). There are cases of forged paintings reproducing the style of establshed painters. They are neither pre existing nor known. I can see a case for someone fabricating a hitherto unknown religious artifact to either ingratiate himself with the authorities or maybe just make a buck..
title: The Shroud of Turin is the Burial Sheet of Jesus!

author: icthus_saltsa
post: Oh, please. It is the paintings that are not known. Tersio referred to something either preexisting or something which is known throughout the history. Obviously the artist is known, as is Jesus in the case of the shroud. I'm saying that a completely new item could be fabricated without reference to a known artifact. Someone could produce a sandal and claim it was worn by St. Paul..
title: The Shroud of Turin is the Burial Sheet of Jesus!
